item.title: Couple Questions
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“need to learn, post:5, topic:261519”] savemoreinfo(); savechar();
Would I have to change that?[/quote]

No, you need to change the actual Method, not where it is called.

Read full topic

item.title: Couple Questions
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“need to learn, post:3, topic:261519”][quote author=primadude link=topic=345339.msg2662697#msg2662697 date=1234309402]
You need to make sure the ‘starter’ integer saves and loads correctly in the ‘saveChar’/‘saveMoreInfo’ and ‘loadChar’/‘loadMoreInfo’ methods. If you need any help with figuring this out post back here.
[/quote]Where can I find those methods?[/quote]

Search for them in client.java, by pressing CTRL & F.

Read full topic

item.title: Couple Questions
item.dc:creator: @need_to_learn need to learn
item.description:
@need_to_learn wrote:

I have this as a starter command.

[code]}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 200000);
sendMessage(“You Have Started Your Adventure”);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“Sorry.”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
+ " Is a noob and is trying to get a extra starter!! :p");

        }
    }[/code]

But when I log off and back in I can just do ::starter again… Can anyone help me with this (I’m using a silab server)

And I want to have a food timer for eating so it’s not just massing, is there a code for that in silab?

Read full topic
